text: <https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/3206643#comment-14856255> from catch:

elements.text: from catch:

text: > For the initial commit as experimental, I think it would be good to have real content already in the feed ready to go, so that the module can pick it up as soon as it’s installed. SImilarly, when going from experimental to stable, we’d want to make sure there’s fresh/relevant content in the feed too.

elements.text: For the initial commit as experimental, I think it would be good to have real content already in the feed ready to go, so that the module can pick it up as soon as it’s installed. SImilarly, when going from experimental to stable, we’d want to make sure there’s fresh/relevant content in the feed too.
